author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I'd be happy to try to merge these two packages, but I do have a few downstream packages ([HoldemHandEvaluator.jl](https://github.com/charleskawczynski/HoldemHandEvaluator.jl) and [NoLimitHoldem.jl](https://github.com/charleskawczynski/NoLimitHoldem.jl)) which depend on `HoldemCards.jl`. The problem with merging that I see is that the evaluator package currently leverages the suit types, and using Symbols may require work-arounds that I'd prefer to avoid (e.g., using defining methods with `::Val{:Hearts}`). There's also [Cards.jl](https://github.com/StefanKarpinski/Cards.jl) (unregistered), but that also doesn't use types for suits.

I'm not in a hurry to register `HoldemCards.jl`, so I'd be fine taking some time to discuss further.

[noblock]

Hi Charles,

I'm registering `PlayingCards` because I'm also working on another package that relies them. To get Travis to run tests, the dependents have to be registered. Maybe there's a work around, but I don't know.

Let's think about this. I'm not sure it's a bad thing to have more than one package with more-or-less the same functionality. I suspect your package has better coding (because I'm an amateur!) but the name `HoldemCards`??? What if I want to play Hearts :-)? 

The `Cards` package looks like it's not been maintained ... and I didn't know about it. Any sense?

Thanks,
Ed

[noblock]

Hi @scheinerman,

> To get Travis to run tests, the dependents have to be registered.

I don't think the package needs to be registered to run CI (e.g., Travis).

> The Cards package looks like it's not been maintained ... and I didn't know about it. Any sense?

Yeah, it seems like the last commit was quite a while ago.

> but the name HoldemCards??? What if I want to play Hearts :-)?

Haha yeah, I'm not married to the name-- I just wanted to distinguish from `Cards.jl` since I don't need Jokers (and I need types for suits). But I don't think it would be a problem to include Jokers to make the package more general and add different deck constructors for different games (`deck(Holdem()), deck(Hearts())` etc.).

I do like the name `PlayingCards.jl`. I'd be happy to change the name of HoldemCards.jl to PlayingCards.jl and adding some functionality for supporting other card games if you'd be interested in switching over. There are a few things in PlayingCards.jl which I think might need to be moved to a separate package (specifically related to ordering / evaluation) and some things that can be improved (e.g., avoiding globals), but it looks like there's a decent amount of shared code/logic between the two. Can you share which package(s) depend on PlayingCards.jl? I see [FreeCell.jl](https://github.com/scheinerman/FreeCell.jl) ðŸ™‚, any others? It'd be helpful to know how much work would be involved.

> I'm not sure it's a bad thing to have more than one package with more-or-less the same functionality.

I'm fine either way. This is really just a hobby project for me, so I don't mind a little extra work if it helps the community :)

[noblock]

Is there a way for me to "give" `PlayingCards.jl` to you? I'd be OK with that if you want to put your functionality into the more natural name. I can stop this registration I suppose. This would allow you to rename your package. I may then ask for some features :-).

[noblock]

By the way: Adding jokers seems tricky. I'm ok if you don't. 

[noblock]

> I can stop this registration I suppose. his would allow you to rename your package.

I think that's all that's needed.

> I may then ask for some features :-)

I'll keep an eye out!
How do I withdraw this?? Do you know?
Oops, I may have in my last comment (without the `[noblock]`). @giordano Do you mind closing this PR and #33050? I'll rename HoldemCards.jl and we can re-register under the new name.

Hi Charles: OK. The name is yours! When you've got your working, I'll delete mine from my github. If you have a chance, can point me to your documentation? I have another project using cards and I'll need to fix my function calls as needed.

My documentation is a bit sparse at the moment ðŸ˜¬, but we can add some ðŸ™‚. Also, the doc page is now broken (since I've just renamed it). But here is the repo: https://github.com/charleskawczynski/PlayingCards.jl

I'll try to get the infrastructure and things up and running again tonight (looks like the PR I just opened is working, maybe I'll take a pass at the docs tonight)-- my lunch break is just about to end soon.

body:
- Registering package: PlayingCards
- Repository: https://github.com/scheinerman/PlayingCards.jl
- Created by: @scheinerman
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 925cc89b127e3cadeaee83e7f255a292cfefd520
- Git reference: master
title: New package: PlayingCards v0.1.0
